chapter.title: Installing redBorder Manager Enterprise
chapter.para: Welcome to the installation of redBorder Enterprise solution. Thanks to this guide, anyone can set up the platform without having knowledge of specific programming from Linux

Installing the redborder Enterprise Manager edition is the first step to start monitoring and securing your network data with the redborder solution. You should check the contents of this chapter before beginning the installation of the platform (also referred as the redborder Manager).

section.title: Obtaining the ISO
section.para: Redborder Enterprise Edition is distributed as an ISO file that can be obtained in different ways. If you don’t have the ISO file, please contact our sales team (sales@redborder.com) or our support team (support@redborder.com) to provide you the last available ISO file or a way to download it.

section.title: Burning / Handling the ISO Image
section.para: In case of installation on physical machine, it is possible to burn the ISO image on a DVD or USB storage device to proceed with its installation
In case of installation in virtual machine, it will be enough to mount the ISO image in a virtual DVD device.

section.title: Installation Requirements
section.para: The following requirements are related to a single node installation with light to moderate use. Please consider that if you run the platform in a virtual environment you should usually get the performance somehow decreased comparing to a similar physical machine deployment.

section.title: Installation Process
section.para: As soon as your system boots with the redborder ISO image you will see the redborder Enterprise installation Welcome Screen with useful options related to the operation of your computer..

listitem.para: Install Manager: Performs Manager software installation on the computer.
Rescue installed System: start rescue mode in those cases which there are problems booting your machine (advanced mode).
Boot from Local Drive: Booting from local disk (default).
Memory Test: Memory testing available for installation system.

section.para: Select Install Manager option to start the installation process.
System will show a screen to select the drive to install the platform, the root user password and the Licensing model:
Thanks to the installation wizard you can leave the manager configured and ready quickly and easily without having the need for special programming skills in Linux.

note.title: Note
note.para: You can also follow a complete guide from our support page by accessing this link: https://support.redborder.com/hc/en-us/articles/360000962497-RedBorder-Enterprise-Installation-Guide

section.title: Possible drawbacks during installation.
section.para: It is unlikely, but possible that errors may occur during the installation process. Some of them will be mentioned in this guide, and how to solve it.

important.title: Important
important.para: Once the installation is complete with 100%, before reboot it's VERY IMPORTANT to remove the USB from the computer or it will recognize it as part of the HD structure, and then fail.

section.para: After partitioning the disk in the installation process, the partition will be named VolGroup by default. If you perform a second manager installation later (without renaming the group volume), you will get this error.
To fix it, it's as simple as removing the volgroup. You can use Gparted to perform this action.
This error indicates that the volume group name "VolGroup" is already in use. This is due to a bad burn of the ISO in the bootable USB or a bad partition in the HD before the installation.

The solution is to recreate a new bootable usb making sure there are no errors. As indicated in the guide mentioned above, in order to burn the ISO image from a Linux system to a USB device, you can use dd command.
